recipes.name: Spicy Red Curry Veggie Wraps
instructions: Step 1: Slice the mixed bell peppers, red cabbage, carrots, and zucchini into thin strips.
Step 2: Sauté vegetables in a pan with sesame oil until tender.
Step 3: Stir in red curry paste and a splash of apple cider vinegar, cook for 2 more minutes.
Step 4: Lay out tortillas and fill with cooked veggies, cilantro, and parsley.
Step 5: Season with salt and pepper before wrapping.
Step 6: Serve with extra cilantro and enjoy hot or cold.

recipes.name: Mustard Maple Glazed Grilled Veggies
instructions: Step 1: Mix together Coleman's mustard and maple syrup to make a glaze.
Step 2: Chop mixed bell peppers and zucchini into large pieces.
Step 3: Coat the veggies with the mustard maple glaze.
Step 4: Heat olive oil in a grill pan, and grill vegetables until caramelized and tender.
Step 5: Season with a pinch of salt and sprinkle sunflower seeds on top.
Step 6: Serve warm as a side dish or main.

recipes.name: Cilantro Lime Apple Slaw
instructions: Step 1: Thinly slice red cabbage, carrots, and red apples into matchsticks.
Step 2: Chop cilantro and mix with cabbage, carrots, and apples in a large bowl.
Step 3: In a separate bowl, combine mayonnaise, apple cider vinegar, and a squeeze of lime juice.
Step 4: Add pickled onions to the slaw and pour the mayonnaise dressing over the top.
Step 5: Season with salt and pepper, toss well, and adjust to taste.
Step 6: Chill before serving for a refreshing side salad.

recipes.name: Egg and Parmigiano-Reggiano Breakfast Bake
instructions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Step 2: Chop mixed bell peppers, red cabbage, and zucchini into small pieces.
Step 3: In a skillet, sauté vegetables with olive oil until soft.
Step 4: In a baking dish, whisk eggs with grated Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese, salt, and pepper.
Step 5: Add sautéed vegetables to the egg mixture and stir to combine.
Step 6: Bake for 25-30 minutes until golden brown and set in the middle.
Step 7: Slice and serve with additional grated cheese on top.

recipes.name: Spicy Mango Sesame Salad
instructions: Step 1: Peel and cube the mango.
Step 2: Julienne the mixed bell peppers and red cabbage.
Step 3: Slice citrus fruits to extract segments.
Step 4: Combine mango, bell peppers, red cabbage, citrus segments, and pickled jalapeños in a large bowl.
Step 5: Drizzle with Yokki sesame oil and toss well.
Step 6: Sprinkle with chia seeds, season with salt and pepper, and serve fresh.

recipes.name: Ketchup and Honey Mustard Glazed Chicken
instructions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Step 2: Mix ketchup, honey mustard, and apple cider vinegar in a bowl.
Step 3: Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
Step 4: Place chicken in a baking dish and coat with the ketchup and mustard mixture.
Step 5: Bake for 25-30 minutes until chicken is cooked through and glaze is caramelized.
Step 6: Let rest for 5 minutes before slicing and serving.

recipes.name: Banana and Date Smoothie
instructions: Step 1: Peel and slice bananas.
Step 2: Pit and chop dates.
Step 3: Squeeze citrus fruits to extract juice.
Step 4: In a blender, combine bananas, dates, citrus juice, and yogurt or milk.
Step 5: Blend until smooth and creamy.
Step 6: Serve chilled as a refreshing breakfast or snack.
